Key Match Events: Craig Goodwin scored a screamer to give the Socceroos the lead.
Xie Wenneng scored against the run of play in the first half, silencing the 46,291 supporters at Adelaide Oval.
Goals to Lewis Miller, a Craig Goodwin screamer and a debut goal to Nishan Velupillay gave the Socceroos a much-needed victory.
China, who have now lost four-straight internationals for the first time since 2003, battled bravely and robustly, but were powerless to deny Goodwin's screamer.
Nishan Velupillay smartly finished in stoppage time, the pressure valve was finally released.
Debutant Nishan Velupillay scored his first international goal.
China make another change as Li Lei goes down with what looks like a groin issue, he's replaced by Liu Yang.
Jordan Bos is going to come on as Tony Popovic makes another change, Aziz Behich is the man who makes way.
China ring the changes, Zhang Yuning and Wei Shihao are off for China, Jin Cheng and Lin Liangming are on, Jin for his debut.
Pre-Game Insights: The Socceroos were at real risk of drifting out of contention for the top two qualification spots in this third phase of qualification from the AFC.
After making five changes from Graham Arnold's last side that laboured to a draw against Indonesia, the Socceroos were likely to be disjointed.
The Socceroos were dominated by China in the first half, with almost 80 per cent possession, but were caught on the counter attack by Xie, whose brilliant finish stunned Adelaide Oval.
The Socceroos did not panic though and, in first-half stoppage time, found themselves level thanks to Miller's header.
Getting the goal right before half-time definitely swung momentum in our favour.

In previous games, we may have felt a bit flustered and felt the pressure to score the goal, but tonight we were more patient, trusted the opportunities would come and, when we got them, we would take them.
Hats off to the boys. We were running them down. After the first two games, the results that we had, it could have gone into our shell but we found big character to respond in the way that we did.
A big three points and now we need to move onto a big game away.
Post-Match Reflections: Although not many who saw the match would say it was pretty, in truth the only thing that mattered for the Socceroos was getting the victory.
The strike was utterly sublime, 'just as I imagined it,' according to Goodwin, and lifted the Socceroos into a second half display that was far more impressive than their first.
Craig Goodwin gets a standing ovation from the crowd that used to salute him as an Adelaide United star.
Craig Goodwin comments on his goal, saying it was 'exactly how I imagined it' and that he was used to playing centrally at his age.
The only goal that was better than that was his World Cup goal.
He adds that the only goal that was better than that was his World Cup goal.
He says the goal was 'exactly how I imagined it' and that he was used to playing centrally at his age.
The Socceroos will face a far sterner test on Tuesday, when they take on group leaders Japan in Saitama (9:35pm AEST).
Miscellaneous Highlights: The attendance is 46,291 tonight, as the South Australian supporters come out in force.
The game was played at Adelaide Oval.
The Socceroos dominated the opening 20 minutes with almost 80 per cent possession.
China, who have now lost four-straight internationals for the first time since 2003, battled bravely and robustly, but were powerless to deny Goodwin's screamer.
The Socceroos were at real risk of drifting out of contention for the top two qualification spots in this third phase of qualification from the AFC.
The Socceroos will face a far sterner test on Tuesday, when they take on group leaders Japan in Saitama (9:35pm AEST).

McGree made a hell of a difference after he came on.
Nestory was not quite happening for in the first half.
Jordan Bos had a nice run.
